resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

kou commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228377364
 
 

 ##########
 File path: c_glib/arrow-glib/input-stream.cpp
 ##########
 @@ -516,6 +516,10 @@ namespace garrow {
       return input_stream_;
     }
 
+    bool closed() const override {
+      return !!g_input_stream_is_closed(input_stream_);
 
 Review comment:
   That's fine except `!!` is needless.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228466314
 
 

 ##########
 File path: c_glib/arrow-glib/input-stream.cpp
 ##########
 @@ -516,6 +516,10 @@ namespace garrow {
       return input_stream_;
     }
 
+    bool closed() const override {
+      return !!g_input_stream_is_closed(input_stream_);
 
 Review comment:
   Won't the implicit cast from `gboolean` to `bool` emit a warning otherwise?

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228673871
 
 

 ##########
 File path: c_glib/arrow-glib/input-stream.cpp
 ##########
 @@ -516,6 +516,10 @@ namespace garrow {
       return input_stream_;
     }
 
+    bool closed() const override {
+      return !!g_input_stream_is_closed(input_stream_);
 
 Review comment:
   Umm. I can't reproduce the warning with `g++ (Debian 8.2.0-8) 8.2.0` without `!!`.
   Anyway, I understand what you want to care. it's OK to me that we use explicit cast here but I want to use `static_cast<bool>(...)` instead `!!...` in GLib bindings.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228670464
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/io.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -989,9 +1035,67 @@ cdef class BufferReader(NativeFile):
         else:
             self.buffer = py_buffer(obj)
 
-        self.rd_file.reset(new CBufferReader(self.buffer.buffer))
+        self.set_random_access_file(shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile](
+            new CBufferReader(self.buffer.buffer)))
         self.is_readable = True
-        self.closed = False
+
+
+cdef class CompressedInputStream(NativeFile):
+    """
+    An input stream wrapper which decompresses data on the fly.
+
+    Parameters
+    ----------
+    stream : pa.NativeFile
+    compression : str
+        The compression type (e.g. "gzip" or "bz2")
 
 Review comment:
   is lz4 supported or just these two?

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228671086
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/io.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -989,9 +1035,67 @@ cdef class BufferReader(NativeFile):
         else:
             self.buffer = py_buffer(obj)
 
-        self.rd_file.reset(new CBufferReader(self.buffer.buffer))
+        self.set_random_access_file(shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile](
+            new CBufferReader(self.buffer.buffer)))
         self.is_readable = True
-        self.closed = False
+
+
+cdef class CompressedInputStream(NativeFile):
+    """
+    An input stream wrapper which decompresses data on the fly.
+
+    Parameters
+    ----------
+    stream : pa.NativeFile
+    compression : str
+        The compression type (e.g. "gzip" or "bz2")
+    """
+    def __cinit__(self, NativeFile stream, compression):
 
 Review comment:
   Using `__cinit__` is unsafe if passing no arguments is not an option (will segfault). Suggest we use a factory function to construct or similar. Speaking of which `pa.BufferReader` has the same issue

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228669631
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/io.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -101,28 +101,54 @@ cdef class NativeFile:
         """
         raise UnsupportedOperation()
 
+    @property
+    def closed(self):
+        if self.is_readable:
+            return self.input_stream.get().closed()
+        elif self.is_writable:
+            return self.output_stream.get().closed()
+        else:
+            return True
+
     def close(self):
         if not self.closed:
             with nogil:
                 if self.is_readable:
-                    check_status(self.rd_file.get().Close())
+                    check_status(self.input_stream.get().Close())
                 else:
-                    check_status(self.wr_file.get().Close())
-        self.closed = True
+                    check_status(self.output_stream.get().Close())
 
     def flush(self):
         """Flush the buffer stream, if applicable.
 
         No-op to match the IOBase interface."""
         self._assert_open()
 
-    cdef read_handle(self, shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile]* file):
+    cdef set_random_access_file(self, shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile] handle):
+        self.input_stream = <shared_ptr[InputStream]> handle
+        self.random_access = handle
+        self.is_seekable = True
+
+    cdef set_input_stream(self, shared_ptr[InputStream] handle):
+        self.input_stream = handle
+        self.random_access.reset()
+        self.is_seekable = False
+
+    cdef set_output_stream(self, shared_ptr[OutputStream] handle):
+        self.output_stream = handle
 
 Review comment:
   seekable should get set to False here? (maybe esoteric)

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228669918
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/io.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -101,28 +101,54 @@ cdef class NativeFile:
         """
         raise UnsupportedOperation()
 
+    @property
+    def closed(self):
+        if self.is_readable:
+            return self.input_stream.get().closed()
+        elif self.is_writable:
+            return self.output_stream.get().closed()
+        else:
+            return True
+
     def close(self):
         if not self.closed:
             with nogil:
                 if self.is_readable:
-                    check_status(self.rd_file.get().Close())
+                    check_status(self.input_stream.get().Close())
                 else:
-                    check_status(self.wr_file.get().Close())
-        self.closed = True
+                    check_status(self.output_stream.get().Close())
 
     def flush(self):
         """Flush the buffer stream, if applicable.
 
         No-op to match the IOBase interface."""
         self._assert_open()
 
-    cdef read_handle(self, shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile]* file):
+    cdef set_random_access_file(self, shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile] handle):
+        self.input_stream = <shared_ptr[InputStream]> handle
+        self.random_access = handle
+        self.is_seekable = True
+
+    cdef set_input_stream(self, shared_ptr[InputStream] handle):
+        self.input_stream = handle
+        self.random_access.reset()
+        self.is_seekable = False
+
+    cdef set_output_stream(self, shared_ptr[OutputStream] handle):
+        self.output_stream = handle
+
+    cdef shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile] get_random_access_file(self) except *:
         self._assert_readable()
-        file[0] = <shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile]> self.rd_file
+        self._assert_seekable()
+        return self.random_access
 
-    cdef write_handle(self, shared_ptr[OutputStream]* file):
+    cdef shared_ptr[InputStream] get_input_stream(self) except *:
+        self._assert_readable()
+        return self.input_stream
+
+    cdef shared_ptr[OutputStream] get_output_stream(self) except *:
 
 Review comment:
   Return bare pointers from these functions, will spare a `shared_ptr` copy and fewer `get()` calls in the implementation

wesm commented on issue #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#issuecomment-433556547
 
 
   This seems to be 5-15% faster than the Python standard library, very nicely done. There might be some further optimizations yet. FWIW, it would be worth publicizing this once it's released since this functionality can be used independently of the other parts of the project
   
   ![compressed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/329591/47594587-0df88c00-d94a-11e8-99a8-11b9d1f4d71f.png)

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#issuecomment-433556977
 
 
   Generally it should be roughly the same performance. Especially with slow-ish algorithms such as bz2 and gzip, where most of the time is spent (de)compressing data, not allocating memory or Python objects.

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#discussion_r228706967
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/io.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -989,9 +1035,67 @@ cdef class BufferReader(NativeFile):
         else:
             self.buffer = py_buffer(obj)
 
-        self.rd_file.reset(new CBufferReader(self.buffer.buffer))
+        self.set_random_access_file(shared_ptr[RandomAccessFile](
+            new CBufferReader(self.buffer.buffer)))
         self.is_readable = True
-        self.closed = False
+
+
+cdef class CompressedInputStream(NativeFile):
+    """
+    An input stream wrapper which decompresses data on the fly.
+
+    Parameters
+    ----------
+    stream : pa.NativeFile
+    compression : str
+        The compression type (e.g. "gzip" or "bz2")
+    """
+    def __cinit__(self, NativeFile stream, compression):
 
 Review comment:
   I don't understand what you mean. I get:
   ```python
   >>> pa.CompressedInputStream()
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "<ipython-input-3-44fd52671786>", line 1, in <module>
       pa.CompressedInputStream()
     File "pyarrow/io.pxi", line 1053, in pyarrow.lib.CompressedInputStream.__cinit__
       def __cinit__(self, NativeFile stream, compression):
   TypeError: __cinit__() takes exactly 2 positional arguments (0 given)
   
   >>> pa.CompressedOutputStream()
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "<ipython-input-4-edac10e8ecb8>", line 1, in <module>
       pa.CompressedOutputStream()
     File "pyarrow/io.pxi", line 1082, in pyarrow.lib.CompressedOutputStream.__cinit__
       def __cinit__(self, NativeFile stream, compression):
   TypeError: __cinit__() takes exactly 2 positional arguments (0 given)
   
   ```

users@infra.apache.org

codecov-io commented on issue #2839: ARROW-3576: [Python] Implemented compressed streams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2839#issuecomment-433843061
 
 
   # [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/arrow/pull/2839?src=pr&el=h1) Report
   > Merging [#2839](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/arrow/pull/2839?src=pr&el=desc) into [master](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/arrow/commit/d61988d9bc1c9ca92789523593055da0996e9509?src=pr&el=desc) will **increase** coverage by `0.87%`.
   > The diff coverage is `89.21%`.
   
   [![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/arrow/pull/2839/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=LpTCFbqVT1&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/arrow/pull/2839?src=pr&el=tree)
   
   ```diff
   @@            Coverage Diff             @@
   ##           master    #2839      +/-   ##
   ==========================================
   + Coverage   87.55%   88.43%   +0.87%     
   ==========================================
     Files         410      348      -62     
     Lines       63486    59567    -3919
   ```

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: [Python] Expose compressed file readers as NativeFile

comments.body: {{NativeFile}} currently requires a {{RandomAccessFile}}, but compressed files are mere {{InputStream}}. Fixing this will require rethinking {{NativeFile}} semantics.
Indeed, it would need to be modified to support file handles not supporting seek
What should the API be here? {{CompressedReader}} and {{CompressedWriter}} classes (or {{CompressedInputStream}} {{CompressedOutputStream}}) would mirror the C++ API and make the implementation easy.
I was thinking we could change NativeFile to have a single shared_ptr to the base FileInterface and then cast pointers depending on the capabilities of the file.
That's a possible implementation, but I was asking more about the Python-visible API. Do we add a compression argument to the OSFile constructor? Something else?
Oh I see. I think having {{CompressedReader}} that takes any readable {{NativeFile}} (and CompressedWriter + writable NativeFile) is a good strategy
